edu.umass.cs.txn

Class Transaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umass.cs.txn.Transaction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TXInterface, TXRequest, java.lang.Iterable<TxOp>

    public class Transaction
extends java.lang.Object
implements TXInterface
    Author:
    arun A transaction is an indivisible sequence of operations that satisfy ACID (atomicity, consistency, isolation, and durability) properties.

    The list of individual TxOp operations must either be a ClientRequest or ClientReconfigurationPacket. If any of the TxOp operations is a DeleteServiceName request, the deletion(s) need to be implemented as an in-memory pre-delete operation at both reconfigurators and active replicas so that they can be reverted if necessary.

    • Method Detail

      • getLockList

        public java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.String> getLockList()
        Specified by:
        getLockList in interface TXRequest
        Returns:
        The set of lock identifiers needed for this transaction in lexicographic order. The lock identifiers are in general a subset of participant groups in the transaction as name creation and deletion requests are excluded from this list.

      • getTxOps

        public java.util.ArrayList<TxOp> getTxOps()
        Returns:
        The sequence of operations constituting this transaction. Modifying this sequence will violate safety.

      • getTXID

        public java.lang.String getTXID()
        Specified by:
        getTXID in interface TXInterface
        Returns:
        An ID for this transaction created by concatenating the issuer's address and the long transaction number; for safety, this ID must be unique across all transactions in the system, so the same issuer must not issue different transactions with the same transaction number.

      • getTxGroupName

        public java.lang.String getTxGroupName()
        The transaction group name must be globally unique, otherwise the transaction will fail in the very first tx_group creation step.
        Returns:
        The name of this transaction, which also acts as the name of the replica group conducting the transaction. The name is composed of the sender ID and a long transaction number that is chosen uniquely at each sender.

        protected java.lang.String getTxInitState()
